full_text:
I'll add my two cents here for what it's worth. The term I have heard in many of my own sessions is 'Heterodyne'. They somehow combine/mix multiple sounds, frequencies and or energy to produce the voices. A good test of this is to have three people reading from different scripts (for control) at the same time, ask your questions while all three are speaking and listen for a loud response in the combined voices in the playback. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heterodyne

Dave

Zack,
Is it possible that spirits use sound similar to our using a carrier wave on the AM radio spectrum? IE, we use turn an AM transmitter on, the transmitter automatically sends out a "carrier wave." Sound is then piggy backed on the wave and sent from the transmitter (no matter what the sound is). 
I wonder if anyone has used a white noise generator in a cemetery with any results? 
Al (from Michigan).

-- Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:


I have suspected that spirits use existing noises and sounds to change or 
modulate them when they produce EVP. I have one EVP that occurred right 
after someone asked "Are you happy?" and during the time a car passed by 
outside the building it was recorded in. When we were in the building all 
we heard was the motor sound. On the recording, the motor sound plainly 
becomes the words "Course I'm haapee."

Zack
